author: Paul Hannon
title: Eurozone Economy Wavers in First Quarter
text:
The eurozone economy slowed in the first three months of this year, denting—but not ending—hopes of another year of strong growth after the currency bloc recorded its fastest expansion in a decade.
The eurozone entered the year on a high after outpacing the U.S. for the second straight year in 2017, inspiring early claims by business leaders that Europe’s economy had bounced back from years of crisis.
